DDS_TypeCode Struct Reference
[Type Code Support]

A container for information about a specific IDL type. More...

List of all members.

Public Member Functions

 Gets the DDS_TCKind value of a type code.
DDS_Boolean equal (DDS_TypeCode *tc, DDS_ExceptionCode_t &ex)
 Compares two types codes for equality.

 Retrieves the simple name identifying this TypeCode object within its enclosing scope.

 Returns the number of members of the type code.

 Returns the name of a type code member identified by the given index.

 Retrieves the TypeCode object describing the type of the member identified by the given index.
DDS_UnsignedLong member_label_count (DDS_UnsignedLong index, DDS_ExceptionCode_t &ex)
 Returns the number of labels associated to the index-th union member. This function is an RTI Data Distribution Service extension to the CORBA Type code Specification.
DDS_Long member_label (DDS_UnsignedLong member_index, DDS_UnsignedLong label_index, DDS_ExceptionCode_t &ex)
 Return the label_index-th label associated to the member_index-th member.

 Returns the ordinal that corresponds to the index-th enum value. This function is an RTI Data Distribution Service extension to the CORBA Type code Specification.

 Function that tells if a member is a key or not. This function is an RTI Data Distribution Service extension to the CORBA Type code Specification.

 Function that tells if a member is a pointer or not. This function is an RTI Data Distribution Service extension to the CORBA Type code Specification.
DDS_Boolean is_member_bitfield (DDS_UnsignedLong index, DDS_ExceptionCode_t &ex)
 Function that tells if a member is a bitfield or not. This function is an RTI Data Distribution Service extension to the CORBA Type code Specification.

 Returns the number of bits of a bitfield member. This function is an RTI Data Distribution Service extension to the CORBA Type code Specification.
DDS_Visibility member_visibility (DDS_UnsignedLong index, DDS_ExceptionCode_t &ex)
 Returns the constant that indicates the visibility of the index-th member.

 Returns the number of elements in the type described by this type code.
DDS_UnsignedLong array_dimension_count (DDS_ExceptionCode_t &ex)
 This function returns the number of dimensions of an array type code. This function is an RTI Data Distribution Service extension to the CORBA Type code Specification.
DDS_UnsignedLong array_dimension (DDS_UnsignedLong index, DDS_ExceptionCode_t &ex)
 This function returns the index-th dimension of an array type code. This function is an RTI Data Distribution Service extension to the CORBA Type code Specification.
DDS_TypeCode * content_type (DDS_ExceptionCode_t &ex)
 Returns the TypeCode object representing the IDL type for the members of the object described by this TypeCode object.
DDS_Boolean is_alias_pointer (DDS_ExceptionCode_t &ex)
 Function that tells if an alias is a pointer or not. This function is an RTI Data Distribution Service extension to the CORBA Type code Specification.
DDS_Long default_index (DDS_ExceptionCode_t &ex)
 Returns the index of the default member, or -1 if there is no default member.
DDS_TypeCode * concrete_base_type (DDS_ExceptionCode_t &ex)
 Returns the TypeCode that describes the concrete base type of the value type that this TypeCode objtect describes.
DDS_ValueModifier type_modifier (DDS_ExceptionCode_t &ex)
 Returns a constant indicating the modifier of the value type that this TypeCode object describes.
void print_IDL (DDS_UnsignedLong indent, DDS_ExceptionCode_t &ex)
 Prints a typecode in a pseudo-IDL notation.

Detailed Description

A container for information about a specific IDL type.
Examples:

HelloWorld.cxx.

Member Function Documentation

DDS_TCKind DDS_TypeCode::kind (  DDS_ExceptionCode_t &  ex  ) 
 

Gets the DDS_TCKind value of a type code.

Parameters:
ex <<out>> Parameter for error indications. The values that can take are:
  • DDS_NO_EXCEPTION_CODE
  • DDS_BAD_TYPECODE_SYSTEM_EXCEPTION_CODE
Retrieves the kind of this TypeCode object. The kind of a type code determines which TypeCode methods may legally be invoked on it.

Returns:
The type code kind.

DDS_Boolean DDS_TypeCode::equal (  DDS_TypeCode *  tc,
DDS_ExceptionCode_t &  ex
) 
 

Compares two types codes for equality.

Parameters:
tc <<in>> Type code that will be compared with self.
ex <<out>> Parameter for error indications. The values that can take are:
  • DDS_NO_EXCEPTION_CODE
  • DDS_BAD_PARAM_SYSTEM_EXCEPTION_CODE
  • DDS_BAD_TYPECODE_SYSTEM_EXCEPTION_CODE
Returns:
DDS_BOOLEAN_TRUE if the type codes are equal. Otherwise, DDS_BOOLEAN_FALSE

const char* DDS_TypeCode::name (  DDS_ExceptionCode_t &  ex  ) 
 

Retrieves the simple name identifying this TypeCode object within its enclosing scope.

Precondition:
self kind is DDS_TK_STRUCT, DDS_TK_UNION, DDS_TK_ENUM, DDS_TK_VALUE or DDS_TK_ALIAS.
Parameters:
ex <<out>> Parameter for error indications . The values that can take are:
  • DDS_NO_EXCEPTION_CODE
  • DDS_BAD_TYPECODE_SYSTEM_EXCEPTION_CODE
  • DDS_BADKIND_USER_EXCEPTION_CODE
Returns:
Name of the type code if no errors. Otherwise, NULL.

DDS_UnsignedLong DDS_TypeCode::member_count (  DDS_ExceptionCode_t &  ex  ) 
 

Returns the number of members of the type code.

The method member_count can be invoked on structure, union, and enumeration TypeCode objects.

Precondition:
self kind is DDS_TK_STRUCT, DDS_TK_UNION, DDS_TK_ENUM or DDS_TK_VALUE.
Parameters:
ex <<out>> Parameter for error indications . The values that can take are:
  • DDS_NO_EXCEPTION_CODE
  • DDS_BAD_TYPECODE_SYSTEM_EXCEPTION_CODE
  • DDS_BADKIND_USER_EXCEPTION_CODE
Returns:
The number of members constituting the type described by this TypeCode object if no errors. Otherwise, 0.

const char* DDS_TypeCode::member_name (  DDS_UnsignedLong  index,
DDS_ExceptionCode_t &  ex
) 
 

Returns the name of a type code member identified by the given index.

The method member_name can be invoked on structure, union, and enumeration TypeCode objects.

Precondition:
self kind is DDS_TK_STRUCT, DDS_TK_UNION, DDS_TK_ENUM or DDS_TK_VALUE.
The index param must be in the interval [0,(member count-1)].
Parameters:
index <<in>> Member index in the interval [0,(member count-1)].
ex <<out>> Parameter for error indications . The values that can take are:
  • DDS_NO_EXCEPTION_CODE
  • DDS_BAD_TYPECODE_SYSTEM_EXCEPTION_CODE
  • DDS_BADKIND_USER_EXCEPTION_CODE
  • DDS_BOUNDS_USER_EXCEPTION_CODE
Returns:
Name of the member if no errors. Otherwise, NULL.

DDS_TypeCode* DDS_TypeCode::member_type (  DDS_UnsignedLong  index,
DDS_ExceptionCode_t &  ex
) 
 

Retrieves the TypeCode object describing the type of the member identified by the given index.

The method member_type can be invoked on structure and union TypeCode objects.

Precondition:
self kind is DDS_TK_STRUCT, DDS_TK_UNION or DDS_TK_VALUE.
The index param must be in the interval [0,(member count-1)].
Parameters:
index <<in>> Member index in the interval [0,(member count-1)].
ex <<out>> Parameter for error indications . The values that can take are:
  • DDS_NO_EXCEPTION_CODE
  • DDS_BAD_TYPECODE_SYSTEM_EXCEPTION_CODE
  • DDS_BADKIND_USER_EXCEPTION_CODE
  • DDS_BOUNDS_USER_EXCEPTION_CODE
Returns:
The TypeCode object describing the member at the given index if no errors. Otherwise, NULL.

DDS_UnsignedLong DDS_TypeCode::member_label_count (  DDS_UnsignedLong  index,
DDS_ExceptionCode_t &  ex
) 
 

Returns the number of labels associated to the index-th union member. This function is an RTI Data Distribution Service extension to the CORBA Type code Specification.

The method can be invoked on union TypeCode objects.

Precondition:
self kind is DDS_TK_UNION.
The index param must be in the interval [0,(member count-1)].
Parameters:
index <<in>> Member index in the interval [0,(member count-1)].
ex <<out>> Parameter for error indications . The values that can take are:
  • DDS_NO_EXCEPTION_CODE
  • DDS_BAD_TYPECODE_SYSTEM_EXCEPTION_CODE
  • DDS_BADKIND_USER_EXCEPTION_CODE
  • DDS_BOUNDS_USER_EXCEPTION_CODE
Returns:
Number of labels if no errors. Otherwise, 0.

DDS_Long DDS_TypeCode::member_label (  DDS_UnsignedLong  member_index,
DDS_UnsignedLong  label_index,
DDS_ExceptionCode_t &  ex
) 
 

Return the label_index-th label associated to the member_index-th member.

This method has been modified for RTI Data Distribution Service from the CORBA Type code Specification.

Example:
  case 1: Label index 0
  case 2: Label index 1
    short short_member;

The method can be invoked on union TypeCode objects.

Precondition:
self kind is DDS_TK_UNION.
The member_index param must be in the interval [0,(member count-1)].
The label_index param must be in the interval [0,(member labels count-1)].
Parameters:
member_index <<in>> Member index.
label_index <<in>> Label index.
ex <<out>> Parameter for error indications . The values that can take are:
  • DDS_NO_EXCEPTION_CODE
  • DDS_BAD_TYPECODE_SYSTEM_EXCEPTION_CODE
  • DDS_BADKIND_USER_EXCEPTION_CODE
  • DDS_BOUNDS_USER_EXCEPTION_CODE
Returns:
The evaluated value of the label if no errors. Otherwise, 0.

DDS_Long DDS_TypeCode::member_ordinal (  DDS_UnsignedLong  index,
DDS_ExceptionCode_t &  ex
) 
 

Returns the ordinal that corresponds to the index-th enum value. This function is an RTI Data Distribution Service extension to the CORBA Type code Specification.

The method can be invoked on enum TypeCode objects.

Precondition:
self is a DDS_TK_ENUM.
Member index in the interval [0,(member count-1)].
Parameters:
index <<in>> Member index in the interval [0,(member count-1)].
ex <<out>> Parameter for error indications . The values that can take are:
  • DDS_NO_EXCEPTION_CODE
  • DDS_BAD_TYPECODE_SYSTEM_EXCEPTION_CODE
  • DDS_BADKIND_USER_EXCEPTION_CODE
  • DDS_BOUNDS_USER_EXCEPTION_CODE
Returns:
Ordinal that corresponds to the index-th enumerator if no errors. Otherwise, 0.

DDS_Boolean DDS_TypeCode::is_member_key (  DDS_UnsignedLong  index,
DDS_ExceptionCode_t &  ex
) 
 

Function that tells if a member is a key or not. This function is an RTI Data Distribution Service extension to the CORBA Type code Specification.

Precondition:
self kind is DDS_TK_VALUE or DDS_TK_STRUCT.
The index param must be in the interval [0,(member count-1)].
Parameters:
index <<in>> Member index in the interval [0,(member count-1)].
ex <<out>> Parameter for error indications . The values that can take are:
  • DDS_NO_EXCEPTION_CODE
  • DDS_BAD_TYPECODE_SYSTEM_EXCEPTION_CODE
  • DDS_BADKIND_USER_EXCEPTION_CODE
  • DDS_BOUNDS_USER_EXCEPTION_CODE
Returns:
Returns DDS_BOOLEAN_TRUE if the member is a key. Otherwise, DDS_BOOLEAN_FALSE.

DDS_Boolean DDS_TypeCode::is_member_pointer (  DDS_UnsignedLong  index,
DDS_ExceptionCode_t &  ex
) 
 

Function that tells if a member is a pointer or not. This function is an RTI Data Distribution Service extension to the CORBA Type code Specification.

The method is_member_pointer can be invoked on union and structs type objects

Precondition:
self kind is DDS_TK_STRUCT, DDS_TK_UNION or DDS_TK_VALUE.
The index param must be in the interval [0,(member count-1)].
Parameters:
index <<in>> Index of the member for which type information is begin requested.
ex <<out>> Parameter for error indications . The values that can take are:
  • DDS_NO_EXCEPTION_CODE
  • DDS_BAD_TYPECODE_SYSTEM_EXCEPTION_CODE
  • DDS_BADKIND_USER_EXCEPTION_CODE
  • DDS_BOUNDS_USER_EXCEPTION_CODE
Returns:
Returns DDS_BOOLEAN_TRUE if the member is a pointer. Otherwise, DDS_BOOLEAN_FALSE.

DDS_Boolean DDS_TypeCode::is_member_bitfield (  DDS_UnsignedLong  index,
DDS_ExceptionCode_t &  ex
) 
 

Function that tells if a member is a bitfield or not. This function is an RTI Data Distribution Service extension to the CORBA Type code Specification.

The method can be invoked on struct type objects

Precondition:
self kind is DDS_TK_STRUCT or DDS_TK_VALUE.
The index param must be in the interval [0,(member count-1)].
Parameters:
index <<in>> Member index in the interval [0,(member count-1)].
ex <<out>> Parameter for error indications . The values that can take are:
  • DDS_NO_EXCEPTION_CODE
  • DDS_BAD_TYPECODE_SYSTEM_EXCEPTION_CODE
  • DDS_BADKIND_USER_EXCEPTION_CODE
  • DDS_BOUNDS_USER_EXCEPTION_CODE
Returns:
Returns DDS_BOOLEAN_TRUE if the member is a bitfield. Otherwise, DDS_BOOLEAN_FALSE.

DDS_Short DDS_TypeCode::member_bitfield_bits (  DDS_UnsignedLong  index,
DDS_ExceptionCode_t &  ex
) 
 

Returns the number of bits of a bitfield member. This function is an RTI Data Distribution Service extension to the CORBA Type code Specification.

The method can be invoked on struct type objects.

Precondition:
self kind is DDS_TK_STRUCT or DDS_TK_VALUE.
The index param must be in the interval [0,(member count-1)].
Parameters:
index <<in>> Member index in the interval [0,(member count-1)].
ex <<out>> Parameter for error indications . The values that can take are:
  • DDS_NO_EXCEPTION_CODE
  • DDS_BAD_TYPECODE_SYSTEM_EXCEPTION_CODE
  • DDS_BADKIND_USER_EXCEPTION_CODE
  • DDS_BOUNDS_USER_EXCEPTION_CODE
Returns:
The number of bits of the bitfield or -1 if the member is not a bitfield.

DDS_Visibility DDS_TypeCode::member_visibility (  DDS_UnsignedLong  index,
DDS_ExceptionCode_t &  ex
) 
 

Returns the constant that indicates the visibility of the index-th member.

Precondition:
self kind is DDS_TK_VALUE. The index param must be in the interval [0,(member count-1)].
Parameters:
index <<in>> Member index in the interval [0,(member count-1)].
ex <<out>> Parameter for error indications . The values that can take are:
  • DDS_NO_EXCEPTION_CODE
  • DDS_BAD_TYPECODE_SYSTEM_EXCEPTION_CODE
  • DDS_BADKIND_USER_EXCEPTION_CODE
  • DDS_BOUNDS_USER_EXCEPTION_CODE
Returns:
One of the following constants: DDS_PRIVATE_MEMBER or DDS_PUBLIC_MEMBER.

DDS_TypeCode* DDS_TypeCode::discriminator_type (  DDS_ExceptionCode_t &  ex  ) 
 

Returns the discriminator type code.

The method discriminator_type can be invoked only on union TypeCode objects.

Precondition:
self kind is DDS_TK_UNION.
Parameters:
ex <<out>> Parameter for error indications . The values that can take are:
  • DDS_NO_EXCEPTION_CODE
  • DDS_BAD_TYPECODE_SYSTEM_EXCEPTION_CODE
  • DDS_BADKIND_USER_EXCEPTION_CODE
Returns:
TypeCode object describing the discriminator of the union type if no errors. Otherwise, NULL.

DDS_UnsignedLong DDS_TypeCode::length (  DDS_ExceptionCode_t &  ex  ) 
 

Returns the number of elements in the type described by this type code.

Precondition:
self kind is DDS_TK_ARRAY, DDS_TK_SEQUENCE, DDS_TK_STRING or DDS_TK_WSTRING.
Parameters:
ex <<out>> Parameter for error indications . The values that can take are:
  • DDS_NO_EXCEPTION_CODE
  • DDS_BAD_TYPECODE_SYSTEM_EXCEPTION_CODE
  • DDS_BADKIND_USER_EXCEPTION_CODE
Returns:
The bound for strings and sequences, or the number of elements for arrays if no errors. Otherwise, 0.
Length is:
  • The maximum length of the string for string type codes.
  • The maximum length of the sequence for sequence type codes.
  • The first dimension of the array for array type codes.

DDS_UnsignedLong DDS_TypeCode::array_dimension_count (  DDS_ExceptionCode_t &  ex  ) 
 

This function returns the number of dimensions of an array type code. This function is an RTI Data Distribution Service extension to the CORBA Type code Specification.

Precondition:
self kind is DDS_TK_ARRAY.
Parameters:
ex <<out>> Parameter for error indications . The values that can take are:
  • DDS_NO_EXCEPTION_CODE
  • DDS_BAD_TYPECODE_SYSTEM_EXCEPTION_CODE
  • DDS_BADKIND_USER_EXCEPTION_CODE
Returns:
Number of dimensions if no errors. Otherwise, 0.

DDS_UnsignedLong DDS_TypeCode::array_dimension (  DDS_UnsignedLong  index,
DDS_ExceptionCode_t &  ex
) 
 

This function returns the index-th dimension of an array type code. This function is an RTI Data Distribution Service extension to the CORBA Type code Specification.

Precondition:
self kind is DDS_TK_ARRAY.
Dimension index in the interval [0,(dimensions count-1)].
Parameters:
index <<in>> Dimension index in the interval [0,(dimensions count-1)].
ex <<out>> Parameter for error indications . The values that can take are:
  • DDS_NO_EXCEPTION_CODE
  • DDS_BAD_TYPECODE_SYSTEM_EXCEPTION_CODE
  • DDS_BADKIND_USER_EXCEPTION_CODE
  • DDS_BOUNDS_USER_EXCEPTION_CODE
Returns:
Requested dimension if no errors. Otherwise, 0.

DDS_TypeCode* DDS_TypeCode::content_type (  DDS_ExceptionCode_t &  ex  ) 
 

Returns the TypeCode object representing the IDL type for the members of the object described by this TypeCode object.

For sequences and arrays, it returns the element type. For aliases, it returns the original type.

Precondition:
self kind is DDS_TK_ARRAY, DDS_TK_SEQUENCE or DDS_TK_ALIAS.
Parameters:
ex <<out>> Parameter for error indications . The values that can take are:
  • DDS_NO_EXCEPTION_CODE
  • DDS_BAD_TYPECODE_SYSTEM_EXCEPTION_CODE
  • DDS_BADKIND_USER_EXCEPTION_CODE
Returns:
A TypeCode object representing the element type for sequences and arrays, and the original type for aliases. . If there is an error, NULL.

DDS_Boolean DDS_TypeCode::is_alias_pointer (  DDS_ExceptionCode_t &  ex  ) 
 

Function that tells if an alias is a pointer or not. This function is an RTI Data Distribution Service extension to the CORBA Type code Specification.

Precondition:
self kind is DDS_TK_ALIAS.
Parameters:
ex <<out>> Parameter for error indications . The values that can take are:
  • DDS_NO_EXCEPTION_CODE
  • DDS_BAD_TYPECODE_SYSTEM_EXCEPTION_CODE
  • DDS_BADKIND_USER_EXCEPTION_CODE
Returns:
DDS_BOOLEAN_TRUE if an alias is a pointer to the aliased type. Otherwise, DDS_BOOLEAN_FALSE.

DDS_Long DDS_TypeCode::default_index (  DDS_ExceptionCode_t &  ex  ) 
 

Returns the index of the default member, or -1 if there is no default member.

The method default_index can be invoked only on union TypeCode objects.

Precondition:
self kind is DDS_TK_UNION
Parameters:
ex <<out>> Parameter for error indications . The values that can take are:
  • DDS_NO_EXCEPTION_CODE
  • DDS_BAD_TYPECODE_SYSTEM_EXCEPTION_CODE
  • DDS_BADKIND_USER_EXCEPTION_CODE
Returns:
The index of the default member, or -1 if there is no default member.

DDS_TypeCode* DDS_TypeCode::concrete_base_type (  DDS_ExceptionCode_t &  ex  ) 
 

Returns the TypeCode that describes the concrete base type of the value type that this TypeCode objtect describes.

Precondition:
self kind is DDS_TK_VALUE.
Parameters:
ex <<out>> Parameter for error indications . The values that can take are:
  • DDS_NO_EXCEPTION_CODE
  • DDS_BAD_TYPECODE_SYSTEM_EXCEPTION_CODE
  • DDS_BADKIND_USER_EXCEPTION_CODE
Returns:
TypeCode that describes the concrete base type or NULL if there is no a concrete base type.

DDS_ValueModifier DDS_TypeCode::type_modifier (  DDS_ExceptionCode_t &  ex  ) 
 

Returns a constant indicating the modifier of the value type that this TypeCode object describes.

Precondition:
self kind is DDS_TK_VALUE.
Parameters:
ex <<out>> Parameter for error indications . The values that can take are:
  • DDS_NO_EXCEPTION_CODE
  • DDS_BAD_TYPECODE_SYSTEM_EXCEPTION_CODE
  • DDS_BADKIND_USER_EXCEPTION_CODE
Returns:
One of the following type modifiers: DDS_VM_NONE, DDS_VM_ABSTRACT, DDS_VM_CUSTOM or DDS_VM_TRUNCATABLE.

void DDS_TypeCode::print_IDL (  DDS_UnsignedLong  indent,
DDS_ExceptionCode_t &  ex
) 
 

Prints a typecode in a pseudo-IDL notation.

Parameters:
indent <<in>> Indent.
ex <<out>> Parameter for error indications. The values that can take are:
  • DDS_NO_EXCEPTION_CODE
  • DDS_BAD_TYPECODE_SYSTEM_EXCEPTION_CODE
